existing_features.title: Build a Texture Generator page where users can select a material category (metal, wood, stone, fabric, plastic, organic, ceramic, concrete, etc.), configure texture parameters (base color, roughness, metalness, bump intensity, pattern scale, color variation), and preview the resulting texture on a 3D sphere rendered with Three.js / React Three Fiber using the configured PBR material properties.

Provide a texture export panel that lets users download generated texture maps (Albedo/Diffuse, Normal, Roughness, Metalness) as PNG files suitable for import into 3D software. Each map should be generated as a canvas-based image from the current parameter settings.

Add a Presets Library panel where users can save the current texture configuration with a custom name, browse previously saved presets, load a preset to restore its parameters, and delete presets. Presets should be persisted in the backend.

Apply a dark industrial / technical visual theme inspired by professional 3D software tools. Use a dark charcoal and slate color palette with amber/orange accent highlights, monospace or semi-technical typography, and a panel-based layout with a central 3D viewport. Enforce the style consistently across all pages and components.

new_feature_requests.summary: Generate textures for any material for use in 3D workflows

Create a backend actor that stores texture generation presets and history. Each entry should include: material name, material type (metal, wood, fabric, stone, plastic, organic, etc.), generation parameters (roughness, metalness, color palette, pattern style, tiling scale), and a timestamp.
